summary: A letter from Fordham Law Professor Bruce A. Green to Judge Richard M. Berman, clarifying the record regarding a New York Law Journal article he co-authored and his involvement in Epstein-related cases. Green states he was never counsel to Epstein or his estate, but served as an expert witness in a defamation case involving Alan Dershowitz.

keyFacts: Bruce A. Green clarifies he was never counsel to Jeffrey Epstein, Epstein's estate, or anyone in an Epstein-related case.
Green served as an expert witness, via declaration, in support of Alan Dershowitz's motion to disqualify David Boies and his law firm in the defamation case Doe v. Dershowitz.

Judge Berman and attorney David Boies had raised questions during an August 27, 2019 hearing about Green's New York Law Journal article and potential undisclosed representation in an Epstein-related matter.
The document is a formal letter of clarification filed with the court in the case United States v. Epstein (1:19-cr-00490-RMB).
The defamation case Doe v. Dershowitz (1:19-cv-03377) is described as 'Epstein-related' and is pending in the SDNY.
